eecs.editor
Class EditableTextPane

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.text.JTextComponent
                  javax.swing.JEditorPane
                      javax.swing.JTextPane
                          eecs.editor.EditableTextPane
All Implemented Interfaces:
Accessible, ImageObserver, MenuContainer, Scrollable, Serializable
public class EditableTextPane
extends JTextPane

This class implements a JTextPane to provide support for text editing and coloring. The coloring is used for sytax coloring; the sytax coloring package is the GNU Syntax Coloring package from Steven Ostermiller, (see The Ostermiller Website for details). The remainder of this class is a modified form of Dr. Chris Okasaki's (USMA) APES editing package (originally written for a JTextArea).

See Also:
Serialized Form

getScrollableTracksViewportWidth

public boolean getScrollableTracksViewportWidth()
Overriden to prevent word wrapping. Requires that setSize be overriden to prevent artifacts (because size of window defaults to the amount of text in the window).

See Also:
setSize(java.awt.Dimension)

setSize

public void setSize(Dimension d)
Overriden to support removal of auto word-wrap. If this isn't overriden, but getScrollableTracksViewportWidth is, then the window will have a white background where there is text, but gray on the right (for any unoccupied portion of the window).

Parameters:
d - DOCUMENT ME!

find

public boolean find(String searchFor,
                    boolean isCaseSensitive,
                    boolean wholeWordOnly)
Find the next occurrence of the specified search string. Uses regular expression matching.

Parameters:
searchFor - A String pattern to search for (regex)
isCaseSensitive - A boolean that is true if the search should be case sensitive.
wholeWordOnly - A boolean that is true if the search should only match whole words.
Returns:
true if the search pattern was found.

replace

public boolean replace(String searchPattern,
                       String replace,
                       boolean isCaseSensitive,
                       boolean matchWholeWords)
Find a substring in the document and replace it with the specified text.

Parameters:
searchPattern - The String of text to find
replace - The String to replace with
isCaseSensitive - a boolean indicating if case should be used in the search
matchWholeWords - a boolean indicating if the search should only replace when the searchPattern matches a complete word (not a substring)
Returns:
true if a replacement was made.
See Also:
find(java.lang.String, boolean, boolean)

replaceSelection

public void replaceSelection(String newText)

replaceAll

public boolean replaceAll(String searchPattern,
                          String replace,
                          boolean isCaseSensitive,
                          boolean matchWholeWords)
Replaces all instances of a specified string with another string.

Parameters:
searchPattern - The pattern to find
replace - The new text
isCaseSensitive - true if the replacement is case sensitive
matchWholeWords - true only if the pattern should only match whole words
Returns:
true if any replacements were made

                throws IOException

Parameters:
file - The File object where the document should be saved.
